name: places/ChIJocTlxL1YwokR4Y2_GZBDNIU
formattedAddress: 1208 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1208 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10028-1405, USA

originalText.text: While traveling in England, I purchased a map from the early 1900’s. I brought it to Jinpra to be rematted and custom framed, and was so appreciative of the time and care offered by the team here. Together, we selected the best products and I looked forward to getting a call about the products completion two weeks later. A prompt 10 days passed by, and my map was done early! I am delighted with the look and so thankful for this quality, local gem. Looking forward to returning soon!

originalText.text:
This is a great smaller quality framing store, but it also sells a limited number of exquisite water color paintings...such a pity that they are not closer to store windows for seeing them better, together with information about their author(s).  The store manager/selling person is very
forthcoming and professional.  It appears to me that this a gem not many
people are aware of. Maybe a store website could be more helpful in this regard. Tina

originalText.text: Wonderful service and excellent quality framing. The frames they made really elevate the prints I brought in, and the art now looks gallery-worthy. Creative suggestions and always conscious of price. Exactly the kind of neighborhood store you want.

text.text: Wonderful service and excellent quality framing. The frames they made really elevate the prints I brought in, and the art now looks gallery-worthy. Creative suggestions and always conscious of price. Exactly the kind of neighborhood store you want.

originalText.text: This is the best framer I’ve ever worked with. They understand art and do an exceptional job. The quality is unlike other places I’ve used.

text.text: This is the best framer I’ve ever worked with. They understand art and do an exceptional job. The quality is unlike other places I’ve used.

originalText.text: Jinpra is a family business that I first discovered through a recommendation of my art dealer in 1989. My most enduring memory is the first time I left work to be framed: "How much of a deposit do I have to leave; Nothing. You'll be back. I know the artist['s work]." And yes, I did return and continue to return. There is no one else I trust to perform the work that Sam and Cherie do. They are artists. I have used Jinpra's Upper Eastside location for over 25 years, first using the services of the mother and father; now the upper east side location is run by their son, Sam, and his wife, Cherie. The proprietor/owners Sam and Cherie are absolutely wonderful, professional and reliably dependable in their final product delivery. They both go beyond the call of duty in connection with assisting a client make the best choice for the type of frame, matte and scale of framing a work of art or photography or certificate. On my last visit a client who formerly lived on the upper east side (but was now relocated to Connecticut) had travelled in from Greenwich just to have work framed. Similarly, when leaving, Cherie was greeted by clients simply passing by. These are antecodal, but certainly a testament to the good work they do, have done, and continue to perform.
